Description: Rim and neck fragment of North Ionian black-figured pottery dinos or krater with everted flat rim; interior glazed, with two reserved bands; exterior: whitish slip, dark brown and red paint; part of a large bird to right; red patches on wing-covert, alternate feathers and some scales of the bird; filling ornament: blobs; whitish slip on top of rim, remains of painted decoration; drill hole on broken edge of fragment for analysis.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D pl. IV, 46)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.435)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.16)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
